short_summary: Canadian Coast Guard (CCG)require waterproof battery cells for floating aid lanterns
description: The statement of work (SOW) defines the requirement to develop two regional individual standing offers (RISOs) to supply waterproof battery cells for floating aids and provide safety in marine transportation and recreational boating. The Canadian Coast Guard requires waterproof battery cells to power the lanterns on floating aids, as specified in the Canada Shipping Act, 2001. This requirement is for the supply and delivery of waterproof battery cells that are configured for the Four Season Buoy Program.

#### Tender Description

The bid solicitation is seeking two separate Regional Individual Offers (RISOs) for the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) to supply and deliver waterproof battery cells to power Floating Aid Lanterns. These battery cells are needed to meet requirements under the Canada Shipping Act, 2001. The bids will be open for a two-year period with an option to extend for a further year.

This requirement is subject to various trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, the Canadian Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership, the Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement, and the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement.

#### Important Notice to Suppliers

Suppliers must submit their bids electronically using Canada Post epost Connect. Bids will not be accepted by email, fax, or in person. This solicitation is subject to the Federal Contractors Program (FCP) for employment equity and the Phased Bid (Offer) Compliance Process (PBCP).
